content: Probably best VR player from point of functionality, but 2 moments can be improved that will raise the bar for all VR community: - file browsing interface - not user friendly - some files with HEVC HVC1 codec doesn't supported :-( Good luck guys!
actually PLAYS my vuze xr videos. NONE of the others did this correctly or at all. gladly paid the $2.50 to keep good projects alive.

What difference is there between a paid and an unpaid one other than the one with ads. Can all the files be in a 'newest to oldest order' (i.e. sort by date) in the purchased app. There should be a lot of upgrades to be done to this app since it is not up to standard.
This one the most reliable VR player. The codec are up to date. Good file browser. Playing all 4K video on 24 FPS. With Samsung A70. Could use a non VR UI like Var VR app
The best VR APP ever. For the first time in my life I reviewed a VR app. Have tried more than 100 apps ,But none of them can Defeat this app Recommended to purchase this app for full features.

Almost perfect but it needs a setting to turn off the tap the screen to calibrate feature, the daydream and a few other headsets have soft buttons in them that rest on the screen and register as a tap every so often, it's constantly re centering the video when I try to look around.
The settings on headset-setup on lense-distance won't save. It always goes back to its original numbers. I need refund.
replyContent: Hi, sorry you were not happy with VRTV! Google has removed the api for changing headset options so this doesnt work anymore and will be removed in a future release. If you cannot get a refund through the Play Store, send your purchase details to my developer email and I will help you.

content: Wish 2d videos could be made bigger instead of just a standard screen size. But other than that I like this player. Best I've found so far
Zoom not working (getting to default after play) menu option not possible to change in headsets. Getting back to default after exit.
Not sure why but when I try and change the settings in the headset profile, they don't save, making videos /content impossible to watch properly
I paid for it.. But cant play HD video above 720p

Headset profile does preserve any changes made and does not seem to have any impact on a picture. Is there any additional setting to enable headset profile manipulation or is this functionality basically does not work?

This is a flexible app that allows repositioning of camera for watching movies and screen locking. Opportunities for improvement: 1. It seems animated GIFs are not supported at least on Android 10. 2. From a usability perspective, when selecting screen, video type, and projection type before watching a video, it would be half the phone presses if all options were available on buttons instead of having to first press to open each dropdown menu.

*** UPDATE *** Windows 10 Media sharing is total trash. I now use Kodi, and have 100% success rate viewing files. A couple issues still prevent a 5/5 rating though: 1) The app forgets what folder / file I'm on, so clicking "Next button" (occasionally, not usually) doesn't work and I have to exit, re-pick my data source, and locate my folder again. Pretty minor, but still. 2) When streaming RTP, in 2D mode it receives my stream perfectly (I'm streaming a desktop which is a SBS VR image from either Insta360 Evo player or from Premiere Pro). I once had it working in 3D mode, totally randomly but it seems very buggy. *** END UPDATE, rest is old review*** Provisional 3-star rating because: 1) the actual player is great with a very basic VR setup (gaze controls). 2) I've been able to access Windows shared files BUT 3) What hasn't worked yet is accessing Windows 10 files shared through Media Streaming. I get all the folders listed, but no files appear. Has anyone achieved this, ever? If I can get that working, then I will happily change my vote to 5-stars.
This is the best VR player that I have found.

Good vr player, support all 3d vr and normal 2d mode too. One hiccup, it still can't handle samba share seamlessly. Sometimes it works just fine, other times it's not. Using android 9 over miui 11 here. Local player work perfectly. Hope it fixed soon.
Best VR player I have seen. However, it does not support "Full Dome" projection as another APP, VR Player. Five stars will be granted once that feature is accomplished.
We need to be able to zoom in further when watching 2d stuff. I don't give a f about the theatre, I want to actually see the video properly, not just a tiny tiny videoe and a bunch of chairs
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! If you prefer a bigger screen and don't need the theater, you can switch to "None" in Preferences->VR Display->Select virtual environment. Let me know if that helps!

content: Nice especially when paired with streaming from desktop vlc or dlna from universal media player. The app has come a long way with customization and features, but most importantly the developer listens to feedback.

Paid for this app but it doesn't work anymore on Pixel2 since a couple of weeks ago. Just closes as soon as I click on any network folder. Reply to developer: it still does not work (v3.5.1)when i try to access a network file. Just closes as soon as i click on the network folder. I updated to 3 stars though because i appreciate you trying to resolve the issue!
replyContent: Thanks for the update! I think I have a fix for this, but I'm waiting on verification since it only reproduces os Android 10.

content: It used to be the best but right now it doesn't resume the saved settings anymore during VR mode and also when you try to resize the screen in VR mode, the movie becomes distorted.

When the app is set to open in vr mode, the vr UI menu does not show. Renders this option useless, which is a shame because it's one of the most important features this app could have. Otherwise good. Haven't had any format issues yet. Dark mode would be great. Hoping for updates so I can recommend this to the VR community and raise my rating.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, I'll take a look!

content: Superb Superb bhai

Good but doesn't seem to trigger vr mode properly anymore. I hadn't used it in a long time and was disappointed to find somewhere along the line that it no longer properly sets the screen into low persistence vr mode. This means motion blur is quite bad.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! Low persistence still works on my test devices, but I'll take a look!

content: This is Best App i've tried for watching 180¬∞ 3D Videos ! I've tried all the other VR Video Player apps on Google Play and this one is the BEST ! It's much better than VaR's VR Pro Video Player with a Ton of Features that VaR's does not have and other VR players on the Store. I'm using an old Samsung Galaxy Note 3 and pretty much everything plays perfectly. There is some minor stutter here and there on some videos, but this is probably due to very high resolutions and data rates of some of the videos that my phone can't handle. Anyways, Highly Recommended and i hope the author continues updating this awesome app ! 5 Out of 5 Stars from me :)

Was amazing till the update broke it. Anytime you put in a stream url it autocloses instantly with any type of file format I have tried. There's nothing else out here that worked as good as it used to.
replyContent: Thanks for the report, I'm looking at this problem and will release a fix as soon as I can! Edit: Does it work after upgrading to 3.5.1?

content: great app! great! ! the best WOW!

Excellent for viewing 2D and 3D video files. I trawled the store trying to find one that would let me watch 2D videos through my 3d goggles and also played sound on a particular file that several others weren't able to (they were just silent) - only VLC and VRTV played it successfully. Controls and settings all good and allows a plain black background, which is all I ever want as I find the environments distracting.
keeps crashing within 10 seconds of playing 180 video
very good. has a large amount of customization.

I had been using the free version, and decided to "upgrade." While the lack of ads is nice, the almost constant crashing with certain videos is beyond aggravating. I notice there hasnt been an updaye in some time. PLEASE release a stability fix as this is currently the most crash prone media app Ive ever used (and Im including the windows 3.1 and 95 days in that roundup)
Edit: Currently broken on Android Q, but not changing rating since Q is still in beta. The best VR video viewer available, Daydream support is perfect.

So far this is by far my favorite app but it would be nice to have other Theater environments, for a better Cinema experience as well as other  environments.  Because i can program my remote and the ease of functions using the eye or remote This app is superb in my opinion and I rate it 5 stars
Best VR video player on Google play... I just wish you add a full screen to 2D videos to fit the whole screen.

One of the best app for watching VR 180¬∞ & 360¬∞ videos in real 3d subject to video quality. thanks to the creator of the app. Highly recommended for those who knows the curiosity of virtual reality.

It was the best VR player when I was using Note 4. Since upgrade to Note 9, it become average. It's back to being the best. Could benefit from slower and faster playback options. I went through most good vr players, paid and free but the competition is nowhere near the vrtv player
nice player with plenty of features. would be better if i can start a movie paused while i put the phone in the headset
i can't open files from my network. in fact i can't do anything, whatever i try and do, the app just closes.

Help Vrtv. I accidentally selected daydream as the headset. Now I can not change back and I am stuck telling me I need daydream. the option to select headset is gone. have restarted. reinstalled. all no luck. how can I clear this setting?
pro doesn't load black screen Samsung s7

Most of the videos I play end up severly pixelated, choppy, or freeze completely; then the app will freeze half the time, and that's even with quite a few lower quality vr vids. My phone can handle the videos too (I have a galaxy s8+) because it can view most high quality VR videos on Deovr just fine, I was just looking to be abke to view a couole of file types that Deovr can't. It makes videos completely unwatchable. I regret not trying the free version first.
Can't login to SMB shares. It does not accept my credentials. Otherwise a great VR player. I will do a refund. Fix the SMB problem and I will happily buy the app again.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! The current version of LibVLC only supports SMB1, which has been disabled in Windows 10. LibVLC recently gained support for SMB2/3, and I'm working on upgrading VRTV. I hope you will give VRTV another chance in the future!

content: Used to be great, now CIFS/SMB browsing doesn't work as it should. Can't traverse up a level, can't traverse soft links, can't view any shares, just your user's home folder. Basically useless at that point.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! The current version of LibVLC only supports SMB1, which has been disabled in Windows 10. LibVLC recently gained support for SMB2/3, and I'm working on upgrading VRTV.

content: After using this player for quite a while here's my review. This app is good it plays most videos most of the time. The floating ui when playing videos is good. The only problem I've noticed is that some videos labeled 2160P, 8000k don't play properly. While they work fine in vlc. I hope the developer fixes it with time. My phone is honor play (kirin 970) running android pie.
Great app works well bought the full version for smb share access. One imporvement would be to allow file sorting when browsing smb shares. I would be nice to be able to sort by date.
it can watch videos on my router. this is why I bought it

Used to be the best vr theater app available but it's been self exiting play back within a few minutes of starting a new video for months now which renders it completely useless. I've had to go back to using other apps which is a pity since this was a better choice before it bugged out. It has been months but I'll keep it on my phone and hope for an update somewhere down the line since I paid for it...
Bought this because it has settings for fine adjustment such as interpupillary distance. settings don't save
Constantly prompts for network credentials. Unusable for me. Username and password are correct, but it prompts every time for every folder. Used to work great. Sad I paid money for this.

After upgrade to Android 9.0 it is not working well (Moto X4). In most videos, picture is disproportional, shifted to the left, right side is covered by large green part. Before the OS upgrade, everything was working fine (on Android 8.0).
Everything works flawlessly.
Works awesomely
replyContent: Hi, thanks for the review! I would really like to hear more about how the paid version is broken for you? Feel free to send an email to my developer address!

The best vr player I have used, definitely worth the price, you will notice the difference when using it compared to a free one

Edit: I tried your suggesting but it didn't help.   Then I tried out the cardboard app and it did the same as well as every other VR app, so I had to do a factory reset. content: The best vr media player on the app store ATM. But whenever the vr environment is on theater or on none, any video I play will back out in about 10 minutes. On the cave mode and the living room it works flawlessly without any hiccups.
audio not playing on pixel 2

Best VR video player available. The VR UI for navigation works really well. Latest update broke video type/shape/format auto detection from file names in some situations. Especially when skipping to next or previous videos. But sure it will be fixed soon
replyContent: Thanks for the report! Free version rollout was halted due to the problems. I will push out a new update as soon as possible, apologies for the inconvenience!

content: 29 sept update fixed the black screen issue. but sometimes app fail to start. black screen upon starting. by the way, please make the menu button totally hidden when we hid it. the square button that replaces control menu destroy my vr experience, esp when i position the menu right in front of my face... also, latest update no longer have options to hide screen divider, exit and setting icon in 3d view. edit: now i keep getting black screen when i try to open setting

The newest update has rendered this app useless on huawei mate 9. No matter which combination of video settings I use, it is only a black screen. Audio works fine. Not sure why you'd change the video playback in a way that would render it useless. Regret paying for this app now. Hopefully an update fixes this and I will change my rating if it becomes usable again EDIT: App is fully functional again, thank you for the speedy update. Rating has been changed to correctly assess this app. 5/5
replyContent: Thanks for the report! I have pushed an update that I think fixed the most urgent issues, and it would be great to know if it works better for you now.

content: Latest ui update got rid of 2 best features that app got first one is screen positioning and the second one is the ui hiding button it's gone too really disappointed with this :(
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! Screen positioning should still work, I will look into it! I will also look into the hide UI button, did you use it mostly on 3D or 2D?

content: A great app. Honestly the best VR media player I have used. I highly recommend purchasing this app because it is much more refined and feature packed as opposed to most of its competitors. I would like to highlight some of the issues I faced and it would be great if these were rectified. 1. The resume playback function doesn't work consistently. I did not have this issue with the free version, but somehow this is frequently happening with the paid version. 2. Once I exit the app after a session, the phone fails to completely come out of DnD mode. A lot of the notifications are still muted and there are DnD glitches visible in the sound settings occasionally. The only way to fix this so far is to restart the phone. I am using a Galaxy Note 8.
A great app, may i how do I install codec library as some file I find I can't play it
Online network stream is not working fix bug then I will give 5 üåü

I like it, pretty good for what it is. My only wish would be the ability to make the 2D screen as big as you want, I imagine it might "clip" through the floor or walls or something if that was an option. Maybe a blank setting where you can just enlarge it as big as you want? Or even better a starscape or something. 4/5 would be 5/5 if I was able to mess around a bit more with the size. Seems like you can get really big in 180 mode and changing FOV but it pinches the edges oddly. Oh also whenever I set the inter lens distance or screen to lens distance or vertical distance it always resets instantly. Am I doing something wrong?
Head tracking no longer works on note 8. Was working previously. Do not know why.
replyContent: Thanks for the report! I'm testing a fix and will push an update as soon as possible!

It's the best so far in my opinion. It would be perfect for me only it's just this one thing that I can't figure out is when I play a certain video which doesn't fit the screen it left out the green screen/background screen. It messing up the player when I switch to 180/360 mode. Not much in SBS type, but on Over/Under almost half of the screen is green. When I reset view, on my right is the green screen and on my left is the actual video. Is there any settings I could change to fix this in app? I can't find the solution on my own.

Great app. Probably the best on the market. By the way, please add option to change position of media browser and menu in 180-360 views. It is really hard to tilt my head down just to use those controls.

Best app for viewing 360 vids downloaded on phone or over network.. easy to use with many viewing options... Only wish it had speed setting for vids

Really nice app, and is actively developed unlike others out there. It would be nice if you could sort the files in date order. That way the newest files would be at the top/bottom. At the moment they can only be sorted in name order. Keep up the good work!

If you could add in an option to have it not stretch out images on the flat screen when using 3d side-by-side, and instead have it just be half of the original width, that'd be great - all of my stereograms are being stretched out

I'm using this on Samsung s8 and it has crashed 13 times in 2 days. When i get it going it is great for watching stuff over a network as I have a drive attached to my router through usb 3, the only thing is there is major lag on any files over 4gb. The hud is fantastic and the ability to change so many settings is genius, I can connect my Bluetooth controller and even change settings on that. Thanks to the developers for this great app and hope you will be able to fix the lag and the crashing on the next update.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! I always prioritize crash bugs, but unfortunately recently a lot of them occur outside of my code, in libvlc and other dependencies, and not on my devices. I'd appreciate hearing more about your issue in an email if you have time!

content: Best app I've found for watching video in VR. Highly recommended!

Great buy,just add to remember last position in vr browsers and media servers please!

Hello, I find this app one of the best, but what I find lacking is an option for buffer videos. I use a network streamer over 5ghz but still it is not enough. Add video buffering option and I will give it 5 stars.

I love this app. It's the best VR Player on the market right now. Hope you guys add favorite folder feature for Pro version.

Unusable after update. üò•. Now required to use daydream app. Opening VRTV brings up file browser with no way to navigate. Can't externally select a file and choose to play with VRTV anymore. Very üò• sad.

content: It gets better and better!

Apparently VRTV can no longer play files that are launched from a file viewer, but they run perfectly when opened from within the app. Hands down the best VR video player, the game pad support and customization options take this far beyond what anything else is offering.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you're having problems with the new version! If you wouldn't mind it would be very helpful if you could email me some more details! Did 3.2.2 work better for you?

content: Great features and smart UI design. Prettier and easier than other VR viewers. Thanks Chai.

Update 7/9/17: After updating, it's working quite well again. No issues with UI so far and streaming works well. Still wish it had the option for the old gaze controls, but the controller implementation isn't terrible except when in the file browser it doesn't show the cursor "laser."  Previous review: Was a perfect video viewing app until the recent update. Previously, large streams worked seamlessly and gaze-based interactions worked perfectly fine. Now it forces you into Daydream mode regardless of NFC being on, which I do not want at all and don't see an option to turn off. The UI once you're in this mode get's pretty buggy, with the play controls being crooked and sometimes re-rendering into strange positions. Worst of all the previously smooth streams are now choppy and unwatchable. Please revert and I will update to 5 stars as it once was.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. Unfortunately performance has worsened in the latest libVLC I'm using to support SMB/UPNP shares. I'm working on bringing it back to normal, and rolling out a bugfix release very shortly.

content: Wondering why my Galaxy 7 keeps going into "do not disturb" mode every time I stream a video...any help?
replyContent: Thanks for the report! First time I've heard of this problem. Does it happen if you don't enter VR and just use the 2d player?

content: Edit: On second thought this isn't the best way to report failures. The app has historically worked great and the play store's lack of archives is hardly the developer's fault.   When it worked it was the best. Recent updates over the past month seems to have degraded the quality. It fails to play all media from usb on my Nexus 5x. Will update as bugfixes roll in. Would be nice if I could install older versions.
replyContent: Thanks for reporting this bug! I fixed one bug related to OTG in 3.2.2, but apparently it's not working well yet. More bugfix updates are coming soon!

content: Great VR viewer. Cannot figure out though how it determines video format from the file name. Dev. Any manual where this is described?

You ruined my favourite VR player. Now I am stuck with a big white x top left and a line in the middle. The options to hide these do not work.  But worst of all is the drift. Since updating recently I am having to reset alignment every 30 seconds. My gyroscope is calibrated perfectly but the screen is constantly drifting.  I wish I could go back to an earlier version because you have made it useless......  edit to reply: I have tried every type of headset tracking. None show an improvement. I see there was an update recently but the hide settings and hide exit still do nothing when ticked.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that drift has gotten worse for you. Have you tried using another head tracking implementation? Check settings -> headset setup -> headset tracking algorithm? The x and line are a bit tricky to remove with the later SDKs from Google, but I'm working on it!

replyContent: Hi Todd, thanks for the feedback. I want to add a slider for brightness in the VR UI, haven't had time yet. When I upgraded to SDK 0.91 from Google I had an issue with the display always being at 100% brightness, so I tried to make it use the manual setting. content: Love this player.  PLEASE update support for playing files off USB OTG.  Would be a six star app if it had it.
Easy to use but a lot of videos don't have to sound  on my Pixel XL
replyContent:
Audio playback of AC3/DTS requires a plugin. Download VLC 1.7.5 apk:

http://get.videolan.org/vlc-android/1.7.5/VLC-Android-1.7.5-ARMv7.apk

Unzip and get /lib/armeabi-v7a/libvlcjni.so from the archive, put it on your SD card and pick "install codec" from the menu in VRTV. E-mail if you need more help!

content: Playback, configuration options, and UI make this the best VR media player on the market.
Thanks for daydream support!
AVI files have no sound. It's a problem as most of my movies are AVI format and conversion to mp4 takes for ever. Little help?
replyContent:
Audio playback of AC3/DTS requires a plugin. Download VLC 1.7.5 apk:

http://get.videolan.org/vlc-android/1.7.5/VLC-Android-1.7.5-ARMv7.apk

Unzip and get /lib/armeabi-v7a/libvlcjni.so from the archive, put it on your SD card and pick "install codec" from the menu in VRTV. E-mail if you need more help!

content: Great ui design and one if the few vr players that doesn't stutter on my device.
Best VR video player for Daydream so far. Little work to figure out but excellent once up and running. Remote support would be nice but works well without it.

I really hope daydream support is developed for this, but even if it wasn't it's still a good app. The only problem is that when using daydream, the mounts that touch the screen trigger the re-centre input. Is there a way to lock the centre point once you set it? so it doesn't get triggered by placing the phone in the goggles.

This is a fantastic app.  I tried a number of similar apps with my Daydream headset, and this had most of the things I was looking for.  Would still love portrait orientation option, but overall very well done.  This will now be my go to.

Awesome. By far the best be player on the market. Clearest picture, no drift like all the others. Can't wait till I get to use the paid version and can navigate through my library without leaving it interface.
Capable to seek, load subtitle, east to control and many more...
All I want now is camera passthrough so that I don't have to take it off.

Definitely the best VR video player out there.  Could use a spacial audio feature so that turning your head will also rotate the stereo audio field.  Also, some documentation for the more advanced features would be appreciated!
Great job
Please please please add daydream controller support, and otg & network folder file explorer capabilities. Edit- thanks for the heads up!
replyContent: Join the beta for Daydream support! OTG and network folder browser is on the list, but I'm not sure when I'll have time to implement it.

content: Was trying to find a player for free, but none could do the trick. This one way worth the money because it handles every format and has a great UI for viewing with no need to take out of viewer

Good dev job.  All I'd say if u could, add support for use of the daydream controller? And maybe some instructions? I can play and watch vids fine, just curious as to what all the other stuff does (I don't want to break what already works).  Thanks for your work, great app
Please please please.
I love the fake movie theater effect when watching 2D movies.
This is the best VR video player I've found yet. I love it.
Worth the price, works great on headsets without buttons. Only thing missing is wmv support.

Best 3D video player out there.  My only question is how it determines the default setting for a video (ie.Screen=flat/dome/sphere or Video Type=3D SBS vs 3D OU).  When I open different files they seem to have these video settings initially set randomly.  Is there some sort of file naming convention that can be used so that the videos start up correctly, without having to change them each time?
Quite simply there isnt a better VR video app. I've tried them all and this has been the best by far. I really love that recentering the image is done with a single tap. Great app
There are precious few apps that play movies and also work with the Daydream View. This is one of them and it works the best of them as well... can't wait for any Daydream updates.
The controls are very intuitive, I hope this app gets updates from time to time, I'm gonna buy to support developer, loved the free app
can't add subtitles source to movie
I bought this app. Now please inform me how can I make it work for different video format to have audio.
The new update fixed cardboard magnetic button issue. Great job dev
replyContent: Google deprecated and removed support for the magnet button in the latest SDKs, but version 3.0.5 of VRTV brings back support it. Make sure your viewer is configured to use the magnet trigger if it doesn't work.

content: I love it. But please add an option for selecting audio track. Many movies come with more than one audio language track and currently I need to use a different app for those because this app doesn't support this.  EDIT: Argh, with the new update and the inability to play mkv files with audio, this app that I loved basically became useless to me. EDIT2: Oh, thanks for the response! Someone on xda-developers helped me locate the codecs from the vlc apk, and use that. Now it works perfectly! Otherwise I'm loving the new update.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that! This fix was intended to fix that issue, since most users don't have a phone that supports AC3/DTS in MKV natively. You can build and install support for AC3/DTS, but I can't distribute it myself without risking removal from the Play Store. Email me if you need help!

content: It was fine before this version. Please fix it, thanks.     === Edit === Thanks for the hard work, this has always been the best VR player I have, and the new features just make it close to perfect, really wish it to work, thanks again.
replyContent: Apparently my texture fix didn't help Nexus 6P users. Do you think you could send a screen shot of the problem to my email?

content: Great upgrade but still no mkv video and audio support?
replyContent: MKV audio is supported, but I don't have a license to distribute the codecs for AC3/DTS. VRTV can however load external decoder libraries.

content: This was almost perfect - smooth playback, simple UI, on screen controls which you could customise to not be in the way... And then they added custom Bluetooth remote mapping!!! The one that came with my freefly wouldn't work with anything and now it does! This is the only vr player worth having, and I've tried almost all of them

The controls floated around the screen even when locked in place. Ate through a full charge in under 30 minutes on a brand new battery. Sure it makes it look like you are in a theater but no way to dim the lights on the background and had to install cardboard in order to change the settings. Overall not even worth the $2.33 I paid for it.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. The controls move around because otherwise you can't click them, but I could improve the usability. I agree about the annoying lights, they will be removed. Most headset settings are available in preferences, but you need the cardboard app to read headset QR codes.

content: Dosen't work
replyContent:
Please try removing /sdcard/Cardboard/current_device_params and start VRTV again. It seems other apps (for example Magic VR Player) can corrupt this file, which contains the headset configuration, making Cardboard SDK code crash in native code.

This seems to be fixed in newer versions of the Cardboard SDK, and I will upgrade as soon as possible.

content: Nice clean UI. Works with ps4 controller over Bluetooth.  Developer: please add file default settings and a easy way to select a file to play (previous and next is limiting)

This is probably the ONLY player that allows for you to pair, sync, and watch movies with your love ones... However, you will have to make sure that you take additional steps to make it work. Your media will have to be in the right audio format, or else silence will be golden. That means more work for you... converting that video file, the hassle! Other players at least use all popular codecs, I don't see why these guys can't... sad, but not worth the purchase for its needs.
replyContent: VRTV now uses libVLC, and can use downloaded external libraries, like MX Player. You can use the libvlcjni.so file from the VLC for Android 1.7.5 APK, or build it yourself with AC3/DTS support from the source in the About view. Email me if you need help!

content: Still No. 1 VR player on the earth, BUT still need more update. first, in app UIs like file list viewer, LAN support. and it doesn't looks like play DTS sound. :( lastly, really need 4K format support. all oculus files refuse to play. oh.. I missed I want this app to support direct access of internal microSD and OTG USB also. thank you for great app and I eager to see your next update!  =========  from today, VRTV doen''t work. when I try to open file, it terminated. also I try to get into setup menu, also it terminated. please help me.
Decent interface and run things ok but unable to find my external SD card. File explore is very old fashioned and not very easy to locate a desired file
Best player so far. Only missing h265 support.
I can't open my media files. Please help!!!
Excellent app, but after the update not playing the audio formats like dolby or ac3. Please help
Download many but this work best. Fine tunes get perfect.
This is quality software, does what it claims.
It has improved however the drift issue is still there. I used another VR player using android rotation vector and it doesn't drift at all ! please consider including that as sensor option.
Sony xperia

I purcased and rated 5 with hope u will improv codec to play many format video. Or solution for that. And i want report even app idle still make phone heat more than 70c within 5 minute. With many cross check and tested the problem happen when play video from sd card. And recently i upgrade to 6 (marshmallow) it cant read sdcard source cause mm need special permission (root) to do that . Hope u update to full support marshmallow.

Thanks for creating this beautiful app, I'm having troubles centering my videos, is it my cardboard lenses ? When I'm playing a SBS video, there's this shadow like image of my bid that makes me uncomfortable. Care to suggest the best solution ? Thanks !!

The most useful features for viewing 180 and 360 videos & has the best implementation by far. Recommendations for improvement and evolution of the product : make HUD disappear unless you're looking at it , add a VR file browser to allow you to switch & select movies w/o having to take headset off . mostly : port to Steam ‚Äì this video player is better than anything available for Oculus or VIVE.
Any chance we'll ever be able to use the file select ui in the VR environment?  That would be perfect...

Few things that could make it incredible: 1: Create a normal button for playing as the default does not work with Bluetooth controllers.  2. Add an environment without those bright lights on sides, it totally ruins the immersive experience (using freeflyvr)

I'd love to see some improvements in controls, so there is no VR UI all the time on the screen, but shows after the click of the trigger button (cardboard v2). Similar like other players have right now. Anyway great VR viewer, one of the best out there. Thank you for awesome product.

I've spent a week trying to find the best picture as well as controls while in playback. This not only gives me the best picture (via fishlense) but also has in play controls and an automatic centering feature. After using this for less than an hour, I came right over and bought the full version! Thank you for creating this!

Player that gives the best quality video. But i have the issue of video drifting away from the centre of the screen. Are there any specific setting or solution for this? It interrupts my experience while watching videos
replyContent: Drifting is a problem on all current phones unfortunately. Google is continuously improving drift correction in their SDK, and I've provided a couple of different head tracking implementations in settings. Select a different "Orientation Provider" in settings, and hopefully you'll find one that works better for your phone!

content: I'm using this to primarily watch 2d movies in 3d. This player works great with my Nexus 6. I really like the wireless controller integration, the customization controls and the interface with the controls available while watching the movie are great.  I would really like to see a file browser integrated into the theater.   PS. .I love the way you can re-center the screen to wherever you want.
replyContent: Thanks! There is a button that switches between flat, 180 and 360, it's in the center on top of the screen in flat mode and just above the stop button in 180/360 mode.

content: I wrote an article about VR video players and marked it as probably the best. I still think it except it works only for 30 minutes then starts lagging. I thought it happened because vr environment was too resource intensive and my phone became too hot, but the same happened when I turned the environment off. I could test it because you fixed the cursor issue in this mode so thanks for that. This is a really fantastic app and I would give you 5 stars if I could finish a video without stopping it and using another player which was perfect more times during whole videos. However you are better at displaying subtitles. (Sony Xperia Z2a, Android 5.1.1, VRTV 2.6.3)
replyContent: Hi and thanks for the review! I fixed a memory issue that could be the cause for your problems in the latest release, would be very interested in hearing if it helped!

content: Love it!  Rich UI in VR, settings for screen-to-lens & interocular distance (for different HMDs), remembers settings for each video. New features added regularly. Just figured out how to use the new calibration feature and that finally took care of the drift. Highly recommended!

Absolutely the best among vr viewers. works on even the worst cardboard clone. has individual controls for fine-tuning your lenses/headset, lan and sync support for two people watching a movie at the same time, supports all vr modes plus conventional 2d, tweaks for big/small screens, renderer options, alternatives for the drift problem. The big plus: dev is very quick to respond. really worth the money.

To start off, i've tried EVERY full version vr video player i could find, and i find myself switching between them for different videos/formats. Specifically stereoscopic 180-360 degree videos, as each video seemed to play best on a different player than the last.   That ended with this most recent update. EVERY video i throw at vrtv now, looks absolutely PERFECT, extremely fast head tracking with googles sdk, and minimal to zero distortion on everything (assuming you pick the right options) and accurate scale.   I can finally delete almost all the other vr players i have thanks to this update.     FOR CHAI SOFTWARE: the only thing that i could possibly ask for at this point, is the ability to actively rotate/orient 180 degree videos with the analogue sticks of a controller. (i dont foresee this happening anytime soon, but i can dream)
Paid to support development. Would love to see SBS in the file browser and thumbnails. Being able to lock tilt and swipe to adjust center would be great too.

I was looking for a cinema app simular to occulus cinema for the rift/gear vr.  After nearly giving up i downloaded this app and was pleasantly surprised at how great it was,  exactly what i needed, upgraded from the free version almost immediately, very functional and polished.
It combines all the other vr players in the store in one player.

Liked it really much. many settings nearly not possible , wont fit to your device and cardboard. I had a noname cardboard, %50 of applications didnt fit , but with settings, it works very well. sync with another device is also a good feature, it was what i was looking exactly. i dont want my girlfriend to be alone when i enjoy this. it really feels like we went to cinema together. only thing there is a dragging effect. need to recalibrate the cinamescreen in the application every 5 minutes. but still good, didnt hesistate to buy the pro version
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! Have you tried the other orientation providers in the settings? Maybe you can find one that drifts less for you.

content: Good one. But still room for improvement

Easy to navigate around with the option to remove the theatre which none of the other apps appear to do. No problems enlarging the size of the virtual screen and it's great for 2D SBS viewing too - ticks every box - I thoroughly recommend this app.
Love this player, pity it doesn't seem to like full episodes on my nexus 5, stops and starts from the beginning after about 15 minutes, am I doing something wrong?
replyContent: Hmm, haven't run into this myself, could be an issue with over heating maybe? You could try disabling the SDK distortion in the settings, it eats up quite a lot of resources.

content: The virtual reality parts of the app really shine. It has a variety of viewing modes, from sitting in a virtual theater to full surround 3D video. The only area where the app needs work, in my opinion, is the file browser. It's nice to have the flexibility to browse the full file structure of the device, but the browser is a bit on the ugly side. It could do with some thumbnails. Try the demo first, if you're unsure.

Pretty close to perfect for my needs. Keyboard controls work great though a few things aren't quite there yet.  Would like to be able to map own keys,  embedded subtitle support for mkvs, more codecs (some videos have no audio playback), remembering screen settings (size, screen lock) and being able to browse and select videos without taking headset off (SBS menu). Worth the money!

Great app.   Worth the money. Best Ive tried.  Only bug so far is the focus consistently drifts even when you don't move so you have to keep centering. I use the lock feature but then the controls eventually drift in front of the screen.  Please fix.
The developer helped me with getting my shared files playing from my desktop to my smartphone. Very helpful, nice guy. I prefer this over SBS player because of the media controls.
This is the best one.Waiting for the YouTube module to come.All controls can be controlled with head movement.Recommending everyone to go for the paid version.

I still prefer VR Player over this in regards to customizing movie viewing ,but having controls is a major upgrade. I also have issues watching for more than a minute. It starts freezing even with lower quality videos. Also i stream from my home network. Using a Galaxy S4
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback, I can't reproduce the freezing issue on my device, but I'll see if I can figure out why it happens.

If you have time to send me an email I'd be very happy to hear in what ways you find VR Player superior so I can improve.

content: Very good audio and video quality . The drifting almost gone after the update. I wish there was an option which we could increase the screen's curve to have a higher immersion. I also noticed when there is a fast pace \ action scene in the film or when I move my head there is a frame drop or shadowing. Also the 360/180 interface is very close to the top of the screen and easily triggered because it is exactly in the top center and you tend to hold your head on the center more rather than the sides.
replyContent:
Thanks for the review! Have you tried changing the vertical position of the UI for 360/180 videos in the settings? Haven't seen the shadowing my self, but maybe you can try with/without "Enable EDS" in settings?

Curved screen is a great idea!

content: Best Google Cardboard standard video player. A lot of options and loads of updates

An excellent vr player here.. Screen gives a very clear almost pixel free viewing experience on gear vr... Plenty of options in settings to get the screen just right... And the Ability to stream directly from the various movie apps out there has put this app on my top shelf... "Where it belongs " only one quibble... The private TV room is a tad too bright.. Could you add a setting to manually adjust the room brightness possibly under the volume controls..? Would make the experience much more cozy...
replyContent: I agree that it's a bit bright. Manual brightness sounds nice, but I will probably just render it a bit darker to begin with :)

content: I like this player better than the others.. but could you add the feature to choose the audio language?
replyContent: Good idea! I think I need sub menus in the UI, getting a bit crowded :)

content: I like the option to manually setup the headset, the sync option is great to use it with friends, looking forward for new features
